node.title: Live - Changes coming? Hipkins to address impact of Omicron on COVID response
node.content: ["The COVID-19 Response Minister will front a media conference on Tuesday afternoon to address the impact Omicron will have on the Government's plan to reopen New Zealand.", "Chris Hipkins will take to the Beehive theatrette podium at 2pm on Tuesday to discuss Cabinet's latest decisions about New Zealand's COVID-19 Response.", "The Government had planned for January 17 to be the date vaccinated Kiwis would be allowed to reenter New Zealand without a stint in MIQ, but it's reported that could be postponed considering Omicron's growing presence in Australia and the risk that without MIQ it could seep into Aotearoa's community.", "Also up for discussion is whether to shorten the period between the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine and the booster shot. A decision around when to start vaccinating those between 5 and 11 may also be announced after Medsafe gave preliminary approval for the Pfizer jab last week.", "11:30am - Kia ora, and welcome to Newshub's live updates for Tuesday.", "All eyes will be on Chris Hipkins at 2pm as he reveals Cabinet's latest decisions around reducing the risk of Omicron to New Zealand. It's thought changes could be announced to New Zealand's reopening plan and to the period between having the second Pfizer jab and the booster shot."]
